TopicTitle: Mechanical Mouse Industries - Kethane & Payload Packs Released!!!

Articles.Content:
the kethane sensor doesn't work

You need a Kethane Controller and a detector on your rocket, and I've had issues if the controller was attached anywhere other than the command pod.
So any fix for the screw-ups that occur if you use kethane and mechjeb at once?

So any fix for the screw-ups that occur if you use kethane and mechjeb at once?

Hmm... my computer at work worked propely with both mods, i just noticed that the desired mun periapisis is not getting right on oebit transfer , just that till now.

Regarding the kethane & mechjeb issue, there is no indication that they are causing eachother problem as is not able to replicate at all. Testers (couple of buddies) and kulesz looked into it and we couldn't find a problem.

And Matokage, I use C4D as a modeling program.

EDIT: Still busy with freelance projects, next week there should be a free gap so we can finish the full kethane release.

I just noticed a quirk and wondered if something could be done about it. I chose to refuel my Kethane prospector craft in orbit after taking off from the Mun's surface, for the purpose of repositioning it closer to the other stuff on the surface. I refueled the craft by converting on-board kethane into liquid fuel. However, my liquid fuel tanks are in the form of a pair of radially attached stacks, and now they are unbalanced.

I'm wondering if I can use the fuel transfer mod to resolve this issue in future craft, but wondered if I might be overlooking something, or if it could be fixed in the Kethane plugin itself.

Edit. I just experienced an issue whereby 2 of my craft were no longer able to extract kethane. One of them was no longer able to detect it, the other had no detection capability. I restarted the game, and the kethane appeared again. Not sure what happened there. If I get a similar thing happen again, I'll try and be more specific about how it happened.

Edited September 3, 2012 by fnordianslip

Edit. I just experienced an issue whereby 2 of my craft were no longer able to extract kethane. One of them was no longer able to detect it, the other had no detection capability. I restarted the game, and the kethane appeared again. Not sure what happened there. If I get a similar thing happen again, I'll try and be more specific about how it happened.

Kethane stuff is heavy by design because we don't want to make it easy for you.

As for the problem that I quoted above. We are aware of that and looking for the fix. Not sure if kulesz already found the problem. But most of those problems are fixed by going to spacecenter and back, you don't have to fully restart. It is not luckly not major gamebreaking

Kethane stuff is heavy by design because we don't want to make it easy for you.

Did you notice my comment a couple pages ago? I figured out how to solve the "can't refuel empty tanks" problem. I thought maybe we can cooperate to add this feature to your mod.

Did you notice my comment a couple pages ago? I figured out how to solve the "can't refuel empty tanks" problem. I thought maybe we can cooperate to add this feature to your mod.

We already know the fix and cooperation is not really needed. We can't just respond to all the messages, srry.

We already know the fix and cooperation is not really needed. We can't just respond to all the messages, srry.

Great, so this is fixed for the next version. Sweet.

Great, so this is fixed for the next version. Sweet.

Unless Squad fix it soon themselves (rumour)

This has probably been asked a thousand times, I can't get the extractors to deploy whilst on the pad (to test). I have a controller (just one). Do I need to be over a Kethane spot before they deploy?

The sensor worked (sounds and all). I've found a spot but wished to test my extractors before launching but I can't get them to deploy. Do I need to be over a Kethane spot?

Also my map clears every time I close KSP. Where is the map data saved? My Deposits.dat file has a date of 16-August-2012. It never gets updated.

Cheers.

Deposits.dat is the file that contains the deposit positions.

The maps are the PNG files, make sure you backup them often, they get overwritten due to bugs very often.

Abput the drill, you should be able to deploy them in the Extracting menu of the Kethane controller.

Deposits.dat is the file that contains the deposit positions.

The maps are the PNG files, make sure you backup them often, they get overwritten due to bugs very often.

Abput the drill, you should be able to deploy them in the Extracting menu of the Kethane controller.

When the PNG's get overwritten are the deposits still in the same location? I've lost my maps too many times to count...
Yes the deposits stay until you manually delete deposits.dat.
Also make sure with every new persistence file that you delete the deposits and maps or bad stuff happens.

Ill check the png files.

I still cant extend extractor on launch pad. . I even removed all mods as a test for conflicts. I shall continue testing. Sensor works fine.

I've been enjoying this mod so far, really well put together. I made a little video on it.

-Stimpy

I remember somebody having this issue even tho it is reallly rare. Try to remove deposit.dat, images and start a new persistence file. If this isn't working please notify me. Also, was it working before?

I've been enjoying this mod so far, really well put together. I made a little video on it.

Check Known Issues & Fixes, there is a link there to a .dll you are probably forgetting.
